title: server
description: The server/ directory is used to register API and server handlers to your application.

children.value: Nuxt automatically scans files inside these directories to register API and server handlers with Hot Module Replacement (HMR) support.

props.className: language-bash shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
props.code:
-| server/
---| api/
-----| hello.ts      # /api/hello
---| routes/
-----| bonjour.ts    # /bonjour
---| middleware/
-----| log.ts        # log all requests

children.value: Each file should export a default function defined with
The handler can directly return JSON data, a

language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
props.code: export default defineEventHandler(() => 'Hello World!')

children.value: Note that currently server routes do not support the full functionality of dynamic routes as
Nuxt will automatically read in any file in the
to create server middleware for your project.
Middleware handlers will run on every request before any other server route to add or check headers, log requests, or extend the event's request object.
Middleware handlers should not return anything (nor close or respond to the request) and only inspect or extend the request context or throw an error.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

children.value: Nuxt will automatically read any files in the
directory and register them as Nitro plugins. This allows extending Nitro's runtime behavior and hooking into lifecycle events.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

children.value: which comes with a handy set of helpers.
You can add more helpers yourself inside the
For example, you can define a custom handler utility that wraps the original handler and performs additional operations before returning the final response.

will register a catch-all route for all requests that do not match any route handler, such as
